geom 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Unary geometry predicates

Source: R/geos-unary-predicates.R
geos_is_empty.Rd

Unary geometry predicates take one geometry and return a logical vector.

geos_is_empty(x)

geos_is_simple(x)

geos_has_z(x)

geos_is_closed(x)

Arguments

x

A geometry-like object

Value

A logical vector

Details

geos_is_empty()

Returns TRUE if x contains no coordinates.

geos_is_simple()

Returns TRUE if x does not intersect itself.

geos_has_z()

Returns TRUE if x contains z coordinates.

geos_is_closed()

Returns TRUE if the first coordinate of x is also the last coordinate of x.

Examples

geos_is_empty(geo_wkt("POINT EMPTY"))
#> [1] TRUE
geos_is_empty(geo_wkt("POINT (30 10)"))
#> [1] FALSE

# first geometry intersects itself
geos_is_simple(geo_wkt("LINESTRING (0 0, 0 10, 10 0, 0 0, 10 10)"))
#> [1] FALSE
geos_is_simple(geo_wkt("LINESTRING (0 0, 0 10, 10 0, 0 0)"))
#> [1] TRUE

# first geometry is 3D
geos_has_z(geo_wkt("POINT (10 10 1)"))
#> [1] TRUE
geos_has_z(geo_wkt("POINT (10 10)"))
#> [1] FALSE

# first geometry is closed
geos_is_closed(geo_wkt("LINESTRING (0 0, 0 10, 10 0, 0 0)"))
#> [1] TRUE
geos_is_closed(geo_wkt("LINESTRING (0 0, 0 10, 10 0)"))
#> [1] FALSE
